toc.brief: This sanitized sample illustrates the structure of a donor-aligned draft for a public-sector AI capacity strengthening program. It is not a real proposal submission.

objectives.title: Strengthen institutional capacity for responsible AI use in government workflows
objectives.description: Participating agencies adopt supervised AI use practices, governance guidance, and pilot workflow improvements tied to service quality and administrative efficiency.
objectives.citation: Seed corpus guidance + contextual public administration references

objectives.title: Improve civil servant competencies for applied AI in priority functions
objectives.description: Civil servants complete training and applied labs covering AI literacy, safe use, oversight, and workflow design in policy and service delivery contexts.
objectives.citation: Training design and competency framework references

indicators.name: % of participating agencies applying approved AI SOPs in pilot workflows
indicators.justification: Tracks institutional adoption beyond training attendance.

indicators.name: % of trained participants scoring above competency threshold in post-test
indicators.justification: Captures competency improvement among trained cohorts.

indicators.name: % of participating agencies applying approved AI SOPs in pilot workflows
indicators.justification: Measures institutionalization of AI governance and supervised use.
indicators.citation: WB/USAID-style results and SOP adoption verification guidance

indicators.name: % of trained participants scoring above competency threshold in post-test
indicators.justification: Measures immediate training outcome before workflow adoption.

indicators.name: # civil servants completing cohort modules
indicators.justification: Tracks delivery volume and program reach.

citations.label: USAID Program Cycle / Results Logic (seed)
citations.excerpt: Results design should link activities, outputs, intermediate results, and development objectives.

citations.label: Civil Service AI Competency Framework (seed)
citations.excerpt: Competency pathways should combine foundational literacy, supervised application, and governance awareness.

citations.label: Results framework and M&E guidance (seed)
citations.excerpt: Indicators should be tied to decision-making and feasible means of verification.

fatal_flaws.message: Objective wording was broad; revised to emphasize institutional adoption and supervised use.
fatal_flaws.fix_hint: Keep measurable adoption language in objective and align with indicator set.
fatal_flaws.label: OBJECTIVE_SPECIFICITY

fatal_flaws.message: Baseline methodology is described, but baseline values for all participating agencies are still TBD.
fatal_flaws.fix_hint: Add baseline plan timeline and agency coverage assumptions before submission.
fatal_flaws.label: BASELINE_TARGET_MISSING

critic_findings.message: Objective wording was broad; revised to emphasize institutional adoption and supervised use.
critic_findings.fix_hint: Keep measurable adoption language in objective and align with indicator set.
critic_findings.label: OBJECTIVE_SPECIFICITY

critic_findings.message: Baseline methodology is described, but baseline values for all participating agencies are still TBD.
critic_findings.fix_hint: Add baseline plan timeline and agency coverage assumptions before submission.
critic_findings.label: BASELINE_TARGET_MISSING

review_comments.author: program_lead
review_comments.message: Clarify institutional adoption vs individual training outcomes in the objective statement.

review_comments.author: mel_advisor
review_comments.message: Need baseline collection schedule and source owners before finalizing targets.
